alert.note: Alert for Sawyer; Washburn (Wisconsin) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Duluth (Northeast Minnesota and Northern Wisconsin)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 28 at 2:57PM CDT by NWS Duluth
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Washburn and southwestern Sawyer Counties through 330 PM CDT... At 257 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Stone Lake, or 14 miles east of Spooner, moving southeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow unsecured objects around. Minor hail damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Birchwood around 315 PM CDT. Exeland around 330 PM CDT. Other locations impacted by this storm include Little Sissabagama Lake, Deer Lake, Sissabagama Lake, Edgewater, Lac Courte Oreilles and Lac Courte Oreilles Reservation. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: Anyone outdoors, including anyone on or in the water, should seek shelter inside a sturdy building or hard topped vehicle. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 900 PM CDT for northwestern Wisconsin.
